reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a lovely weekend stay with my girlfriend and the dog at five acre view. Right from the start Nadine gave us a warm welcome and advised us on what there is to do in the area. The rooms are spacious with en-suite and the breakfast really sets you up for the day.
reviews.title: Beautiful views, warm welcome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is great, the views from the bedroom, garden and local area are just unreal, although other Moors villages and Towns are a drive away. The white horse, around a forty minute walk (the scenic route!), is dog friendly and the food is smashing! Giant Yorkie, Sausage and Mash is very recommended! The dog was spoilt rotten, sausage for breakfast, a chase around with the garden with the lady dogs. He was pooped by the end of the weekend.
reviews.title: Very welcoming B&B in idyllic setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks for a great weekend, we'll be back.
reviews.title: Just perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed over the Easter weekend and had a really relaxing time. Room was excellent with a stunning view. Was made to feel very welcome - great hosts and breakfasts were great. Just wish we had booked for a few more days. Would recommend staying there to anyone.
reviews.title: Totally Fantastic

reviews.text: We had a wonderful weekend at Five Acre View towards the end of February. From our initial contact with Nadine up until the point we left, our hosts were friendly and helpful; nothing was too much trouble. The Sycamore room was cosy and spotless with magnificent views across the valley. Nadine's extra little touches were mush appreciated, such as the plentiful supplies of tea and coffee, the extra sausage she cooked for another guest's dog and her relaxed attitude towards our muddy walking boots! Special mention must be made of the fantastic breakfast which kept us going until early afternoon. We also had excellent recommendations for evening meals, local walks and places of interest to visit on the drive home.
reviews.title: Couldn't have asked for more....especially when an emergency arose!

likes.liked: — The owners, the views, the breakfast!
likes.disliked: — It's too far from London when one becomes seriously ill!

reviews.text: We just enjoyed a wonderful night at Five Acre View. The location and view is stunning, the rooms were clean and very relaxing, the bed comfy, the breakfast was very good and the owner Nadine couldn't have been more accommodating. Our little dog was made most welcome and everything we needed for our wee baby boy was on hand. I'dstrongly recommend this b&b. Just sad we were only there a night.
reviews.title: Lovely setting and great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have two golden retrievers and the problem with going away is that many supposed dog-friendly places only allow one dog, and don't allow you to leave them in the room whilst you eat or go out.
reviews.title: A 'real' dog-friendly place to stay
Days away
reviews.text: Five Acre View at Rosedale Abbey couldn't be more different. Not only do you have the most fantastic view possible, the most comfortable of beds (for both humans and doggies), a breakfast that goes well beyond the fabulous, and mine hosts who can't do enough for you - but your doggies (that is more than one!) are treated just as well and welcomed into the family home.
For like minded people who enjoy walking, fab scenery and the warm welcome that Yorkshire folk know how to give, this is the best possible place to stay
reviews.title: Stop searching....just book...NOW!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Richard & Lesley Cleaver
reviews.title: Home from Home

reviews.text: I stayed recently with my cocker spaniel, the first time I've taken the dog with me to a B&B. We felt very welcome, breakfast was excellent and the evening meals at the nearby dog friendly pub were a delight. We will definitely return!
reviews.title: Wonderful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are after a dog friendly and home from home atmosphere this is the place to be. You are made to feel welcome from the moment you step in the door, and the setting is brilliant.
reviews.title: One of the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is one of the best Bed & Breakfast we have stayed in and the our two Chow Chow's were made to feel part of the family.
reviews.title: best place i can EVER recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you very much for a great weekend.
reviews.title: Five acre view = five star accomodation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THis bed & breakfast was more than any one can bargain for - the location is beautiful - you wake up to the views of the moors, Nadine and Melc treat as part of their immediate family - the room was very very very cozy with a bottle of wine waiting for you to return from your adventures. The ONLY little thing is their is no shower - just a very nice bath. I am not complaining but if you do not like to bathe, than there is really not an alternative - besides that - it is the best we can ask for!
reviews.title: What a beautiful B&B and host

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a fantastic few days at Five Acre View. Nadine and Malc are the most lovely hosts, nothing is too much trouble......even when we managed to get stuck in the snow late on a Saturday evening malc happily came to our rescue!!!. After just one evening we felt like we had known Nadine and Malc a lifetime.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The house is lovely with the most stunning views, the rooms are beautiful and had enough room for our dog!!.....and the breakfast was delicious....
reviews.title: Home from Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would highly recommend anyone to book this B&B, we can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Please visit here, it's fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our 2nd Visit to Nadine's lovely B&B, this time for 5 nights. We where made to feel so welcome, the room was to a very high standard and Breakfast is to be savoured.
reviews.title: BEST B&B EVER

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing was to much trouble and you where made to feel like a member of the family.
reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect !!
